citations.narrative:
One enclosure housing two adult sugar gliders had an empty water bottle which left those two animals with no access to
water. The empty water bottle had apparently malfunctioned and leaked all its contents to the catch pan beneath the
enclosure; all the water bottles for the other 60 sugar gliders had nearly full water bottles. The licensee provided a new,
full water bottle and the two sugar gliders immediately approached the water source for a drink. Water bottles which don't
function properly can result in animals becoming thirsty and potentially dangerously dehydrated. The licensee must
ensure potable water is provided for all animals as often as necessary to ensure their health and comfort.
Licensee was instructed verbally to correct this non-compliant item by: 24MAR2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.130 
   
Watering. 
One enclosure housing two adult sugar gliders had an empty water bottle which left those two animals with no access to 
water. The empty water bottle had apparently malfunctioned and leaked all its contents to the catch pan beneath the 
enclosure; all the water bottles for the other 60 sugar gliders had nearly full water bottles. The licensee provided a new, 
full water bottle and the two sugar gliders immediately approached the water source for a drink. Water bottles which don't 
function properly can result in animals becoming thirsty and potentially dangerously dehydrated. The licensee must 
ensure potable water is provided for all animals as often as necessary to ensure their health and comfort.  
 
Licensee was instructed verbally to correct this non-compliant item by: 24MAR2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
